Shut the NSA's Backdoor To The Internet

Two amendments are being voted on in the House of Representatives tomorrow. Together, they'd close critical backdoors that allow the NSA to surveil the Internet.

What backdoors would be closed?

Backdoor Searches of US Citizen's Internet Usage

The amendment would prevent the NSA from using any of the funds from the Defense Appropriations Bill to conduct warrantless searches of Americansâ€™ communications collected and stored by the NSA under Section 702 of the FISA Amendments.

Backdoors Into Encryption Standards

The amendment would stop the NSA from using it's budget to mandate or request that backdoors for surveillance be built into products or services.
